result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of both charges. Because Wisconsin law provides for only one penalty even if there is a conviction on both, no additional penalty has been imposed as a result of the second charge.

  • Jason J Lindekugel was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jason J Lindekugel was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).
  • Jason J Lindekugel was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Jason J Lindekugel was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Jason J Lindekugel was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Found guilty at jury trial, no sentence imposed
Penalty imposed on PAC, Ct. 2
Consecutive to: to any other sentence being served

records.addlTxt: 1:16 p.m. Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in court with attorney Michael Scarantino.  Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Grode argues for his recommendation.  Attorney Scarantino argues for his recommendation.  The defendant addresses the Court.  Court sentences.
Sentencing hearing on July 20, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

3:37 p.m.Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in court with attorney Michael Scarantino. Defendant in custody  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion for Attorney Arendt to withdraw.  Court grants the motion to withdraw.
Sentencing hearing on February 17, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on February 21, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

9:10 A.M.  Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in court with attorney Richard E. Bender.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motions in Limine.  Defendant stipulated to prior OWI's and operating while revoked.  Court questions the defendant.  Court accepts stipulations.  Attorney Grode reads in priors on the record  Motion to sequestration after voir dire.  Court accepts.  Motion regarding statements.  No objections, Court accepts.  Motion  #4, no objects from the State.  Attorney Bender argues for motion #4.  Court questions.  Court rules.  Motion #5, opening and closings.  Court rules.  Motion #6, no objections from the State, defense stipulates.  State dismisses Count 5, Court 6 is renumbered to Ct. 5.  9:29 a.m.  regarding evidence bags.  Attorney Bender stipulates regarding the evidence bags.  Both bags are marked as exhibits 1 & 2  Juror 71 will be excused for cause if called.  
9:30 a.m.  Jury sworn in and 20 person jury panel picked.  Attorney Grode introduces himself to the jury.  Attorney Bender introduces himself and defendant to the jury.  
Voir dire by Judge.   Juror #99 excused by Court.  Juror #76 excused by Court.  
9:52 a.m.  Voir Dire by the State.  
10:16 a.m.  Voir Dire by Attorney Bender  Attorney Bender requests juror #101 be excused.  Court questions and excuses.
10:27 a.m.  Court gives instruction to the jury and counsel commence with strikes.  
10:35 a.m.  Twelve jurors are sworn and seated.  
10:36 a.m.  Attorney Grode gives his opening statement.  
10:45 a.m.  Attorney Bender gives his opening statement.  
10:55 a.m.  Jury leaves. Court takes a break.  
11:10 a.m.  Officer Terry Endries is sworn and questioned by Attorney Grode. Testifies to education and training.  Testifies to being on duty and observing a vehicle and beginning to follow him.  Testifies to following the vehicle to a house.  Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom as the person who he observed on the night in question.  Attorney Grode shows the video to the jury.  Exhibit 3 is marked and identified as the officer's video.  Exhibit 3 is received.  Questions witness at length regarding the field sobriety tests conducted and the results of the tests.  Testifies to the items found in the he vehicle.   Witness reviews and identifies Exhibit 18.  Witness reviews and identifies Exhibit 1.  Witness testifies to transporting the defendant to St. Joseph's Hospital for a blood draw. Witness reviews and identifies Exhibit 19.  11:45 a.m.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bender.  Questions witness regarding Exhibits 4 and 5.   Exhibits 4 and 5 are received.  Questions witness regarding Exhibits 6 and 7.   Questions witness regarding Exhibit 20.  Exhibit 20 is received.  Questions witness regarding Exhibits 8, 9 and 10.  Exhibits 6 through 10 are received.  Witness reviews EXhibit 13.   Witness reviews Exhibit 11.   Exhibits 11 and 13 are received.  Witness reviews Exhibits 15 and 16.  Questions witness regarding the defendant's cooperation.  12:09 p.m. Re-direct by Attorney Grode.  Questions witness regarding the photographs.  12:15 p.m.  Re-cross by Attorney Bender.  12:17 p.m. Re-direct by Attorney Grode.  12:17 p.m. Re-cross by Attorney Bender.  
12:18 p.m.  Jury leaves for lunch. Court adjourns. 
1:20 p.m.  Court reconvenes with the jury present.  Testifies to prior employment as a phlebotomist.  Witness reviews and identifies Exhibit 19.  Testifies to the procedure used.  
1:23 p.m.  Kayla Newman is sworn and questioned by Attorney Grode. Testifies to employment as a chemist with the State Lab of Hygiene.  Testifies to procedures used in her employment.  Exhibit 21 is marked and identified by the witness.  Exhibit 21 is received.  
1:37 p.m.  Michelle Fecheelm is sworn and questioned by Attorney Grode. Testifies to employment at the Crime Lab in Wausau and testifies to her duties as  identifying controlled substances.  Witness reviews and identifies Exhibit 22. Testifies to the tests used in determining the identity of the controlled substance.  Exhibit 22 is received.
1:41 p.m.  State rests.  Jury leaves.  Court enters into a colloquy with the defendant, who elects to testify.  
1:49 p.m.  Court reconvenes with the jury present.  Jason Lindekugel is sworn and questioned by Attorney Bender. Testifies to being at the tavern with a friend who was driving his car.  Witness reviews Exhibit 14.  Sidebar.  2:05 p.m.  Attorney Bender continues his questioning of the defendant.  Witness reviews Exhibit 20 and testifies to where he observed the officer's vehicle.  Testifies that he was not driving the vehicle.  Attorney Grode requests the jury leave to discuss an issue.  Jury leaves.  Court makes its ruling as to Attorney Grode's comments regarding certain testimony.  Attorney Bender places his objection on the record.  Court places the sidebar issue on the record.  
2:27 p.m.  Jury returns.   Cross-examination of witness by Attorney Grode.  
2:32 p.m. Defense rests.  Officer Terry Endries re-takes the witness stand and is questioned on rebuttal by Attorney Grode.  Cross-examination by Attorney Bender.  Re-direct by Attorney Grode.  
2:42 p.m.  Testimony is closed. Jury leaves.  Court and counsel review jury instructions and verdicts.  Attorney Bender makes a statement requesting that certain exhibits be sent back with the jury for deliberations.  Attorney Grode objects.  Court states that it is his standard practice to not send the exhibits back unless the jurors ask for them. 
2:51 p.m.  Jury returns and the Court instructs the jury.  3:11 p.m.  Sidebar.  3:12 p.m.  Attorney Grode gives his closing argument.  3:28 p.m.  Attorney Bender gives his closing argument.  3:40 p.m.  Attorney Grode gives rebuttal argument.  
3:44 p.m.  Court gives additional instructions.  3:51 p.m. Bailiffs are sworn.  Jury leaves to deliberate.  Judge puts the sidebar issue on the record.  
4:43 p.m.  On the record without the jury present.  The jurors are requesting photos.  Parties agree to send them back.  Exhibits 6, 7 and 20 are being sent back.  
5:08 p.m.  Jury returns with the verdict.  Ct. 1.  Guilty.  Ct. 2.  Guilty.  Ct. 3.  Guilty.  Ct. 4.  Guilty.  Ct. 5.  Guilty.  Court polls the jury.  Jury leaves.  Attorney Grode moves for judgment on ther verdict on Counts 2 through 5. Count 1 will be dismissed.  Bond is revoked.  Exhibits 1 and 2 will be retained by the Marshfield Police Department.
Cover Letter from Atty. Richard E. Bender, dated Jan. 26, 2017.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 31, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 31, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
